user.title: Create a Magic Area
user.description: Choose the area you would like to make it magic!

abort.invalid_area: The selected area does not exist
abort.no_more_areas: All your areas are already magic!

select_features.title: Feature selection
select_features.description: Select the features you want to enable for this area. A new menu option will show up for configuring the feature if there are configurations options for that feature.

show_menu.title: Options Menu
show_menu.description: Magic Areas does basic presence detection by default but you can unleash it's full power by configuring advanced state tracking, tune in your presence detection parameters and enabling our magic features! Options are not saved unless Save & Exit.

feature_conf_light_groups.title: Light Groups
feature_conf_light_groups.description: Magic Areas creates these four (plus a global one) light groups (if you assign lights to them) for you to use. These by default are plain light groups but can be automatically controlled if you assign them to area states and enable the light control switch (that will be created when you enable this feature). You can also configure the light group to automatically operate only when an area gets occupied, when a state chagnes or both! Additional states can be unlocked by configuring 'Advanced area state tracking'.

data.overhead_lights_states: States which overhead lights are turned on
data.overhead_lights_act_on: When should overhead lights be controlled?
data.sleep_lights_states: States which sleep lights are turned on
data.sleep_lights_act_on: When should sleep lights be controlled?
data.accent_lights_states: States which accent lights are turned on
data.accent_lights_act_on: When should accent lights be controlled?
data.task_lights_states: States which task lights are turned on
data.task_lights_act_on: When should task lights be controlled?

feature_conf_presence_hold.title: Presence Hold
feature_conf_presence_hold.description: Creates a switch that will hold an area occupied while it's on. You can configure a timeout to have the switch automatically turn off after a certain period of time, if you often see yourself leaving it on.

data.presence_hold_timeout: Time after the switch will be automatically turned off. (0 = timeout disabled).

feature_conf_area_aware_media_player.title: Feature: Area-aware media player
feature_conf_area_aware_media_player.description: Creates a media player device that will forward play calls to other media players in occupied areas only. This is useful if you want to use TTS notifications but only want to notify areas that are occupied to avoid notifying media players in vacant areas.

data.notification_devices: Media Player devices used for broadcasting
data.notification_states: Play notifications devices only when on these states

feature_conf_aggregates.title: Feature: Sensor aggregates
feature_conf_aggregates.description: If you have multiple sensors (or binary sensors) of the same type, Magic Areas can group then into a single entity allowing you to have averages (or sums) of sensors or combined state of binary sensors. It's even useful if you only currently have one sensor of each kind as it allows you to use the aggregate in automations and expand in the future without having to re-write your automations.

data.aggregates_min_entities: Minimum number of entities of the same device class required to create aggregates.

feature_conf_climate_groups.title: Feature: Climate Groups
feature_conf_climate_groups.description: Group and control all climate entities in an area. This feature allows climate entities to be controlled automatically according to an area's state.

data.turn_on_state: State to turn on the climate group.

secondary_states.title: Advanced area state tracking
secondary_states.description: You can enable secondary states for a Magic Area by assigning an entity to it. Secondary states are used by features for turning lights on only when it's dark or only turning on climate devices after an extended period of time or not sending notifications to an area if it's on sleep.

data.sleep_entity: Entity used to track area sleep state
data.sleep_timeout: How long area will wait before clearing the state when on sleep state
data.accent_entity: Entity used to track area accented state
data.extended_time: Area will be marked as 'extended' after being occupied for this long
data.extended_timeout: How long area will wait before clearing the state when on extended state

area_config.title: Basic area options
area_config.description: Configure basic options for the area. Area type is used for the Interior/Exterior/Global meta-areas and you can fine-tune which entities are analyzed by Magic Areas by using the include/exclude entities options.

presence_tracking.title: Presence Tracking
presence_tracking.description: Configure which platforms and binary sensor device classes are used for presence tracking. This section also allows you to configure how long Magic Area will wait until clearing the area after the last presence event.

data.presence_device_platforms: Platforms to be used for presence sensing
data.clear_timeout: How long since last presence event should it wait before clearing the area
